beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: The evolution of humans is a complex journey that spans millions of years, shaped by biology, environment, and culture. Here's a high-level summary of the key stages in human evolution

beats.speaker: Presenter
beats.text: Our story begins with tree-dwelling primates—small mammals with forward-facing eyes and grasping hands. These ancestors lived in forests and evolved traits useful for climbing and visual depth perception.

beats.text: The line that would eventually lead to humans diverged from other primates around 6-7 million years ago. These early hominids and hominins were the first to show adaptations for walking upright, a crucial development in our evolutionary journey.
